verses.text: So Abijah slept with his fathers, and they buried him in the city of David: and Asa his son reigned in his stead. In his days the land was quiet ten years.
And Asa did \add that\add* which \add was\add* good and right in the eyes of the \sc Lord\sc* his God:
for he took away the altars of the strange \add gods\add*, and the high places, and brake down the images, and cut down the groves:
and commanded Judah to seek the \sc Lord\sc* God of their fathers, and to do the law and the commandment.
Also he took away out of all the cities of Judah the high places and the images: and the kingdom was quiet before him.
And he built fenced cities in Judah: for the land had rest, and he had no war in those years; because the \sc Lord\sc* had given him rest.

Therefore he said unto Judah, Let us build these cities, and make about \add them\add* walls, and towers, gates, and bars, \add while\add* the land \add is\add* yet before us; because we have sought the \sc Lord\sc* our God, we have sought \add him\add*, and he hath given us rest on every side. So they built and prospered.

And Asa had an army \add of men\add* that bare targets and spears, out of Judah three hundred thousand; and out of Benjamin, that bare shields and drew bows, two hundred and fourscore thousand: all these \add were\add* mighty \add men\add* of valour.
And there came out against them Zerah the Ethiopian with a host of a thousand thousand, and three hundred chariots; and came unto Mareshah.
Then Asa went out against him, and they set the battle in array in the valley of Zephathah at Mareshah.

And Asa cried unto the \sc Lord\sc* his God, and said, \sc Lord\sc*, \add it is\add* nothing with thee to help, \add whether\add* with many, \add or\add* with \add them that have\add* no power: help us, O \sc Lord\sc* our God; for we rest on thee, and in thy name we go against this multitude. O \sc Lord\sc*, thou \add art\add* our God; let not man prevail against thee.
So the \sc Lord\sc* smote the Ethiopians before Asa, and before Judah; and the Ethiopians fled.

And Asa and the people that \add were\add* with him pursued them unto Gerar: and the Ethiopians were overthrown, that they could not recover themselves; for they were destroyed before the \sc Lord\sc*, and before his host; and they carried away very much spoil.
And they smote all the cities round about Gerar; for the fear of the \sc Lord\sc* came upon them: and they spoiled all the cities; for there was \add exceeding\add* much spoil in them.
They smote also the tents of cattle, and carried away sheep and camels in abundance, and returned \add to\add* Jerusalem.
